description: pheno- +‎ -type. (Date to be specified). From Ancient Greek φαίνω (phaínō, “to shine, to show, to appear”) and Ancient Greek τύπος (túpos, “mark, type”).

entries.meaning: (genetics, evolutionary theory) The appearance of an organism based on a multifactorial combination of genetic traits and environmental factors, especially used in pedigrees.
(genetics, evolutionary theory) Any observable characteristic of an organism, such as its morphological, developmental, biochemical or physiological properties, or its behavior.

verbs.description: phenotype (third-person singular simple present phenotypes, present participle phenotyping, simple past and past participle phenotyped)

entries.meaning: To evaluate or classify based on phenotype
